problem.markdown:
1. What is the value of logarithmic decrement if amplitude drops by 2 times between consecutive peaks ?
( ) 0.301 (x) 0.693 ( ) 0.602 ( ) 0.346
2. The amplitude of a damped system will not change with time.
(x) false ( ) true
3. A rod 20 mm diameters and 1.2 m long is simply supported at both end and has a mass of 2kg concentrated at the middle. Ignoring the weight of the rod, calculate the frequency of transverse vibrations. Take E=200 Gpa.?
( ) 5.88Hz (x) 23.52Hz ( ) 11.76Hz ( ) 47.04Hz
4. The magnification factor is the ratio of maximum amplitude and static deflection.
( ) false (x) true
5. For an under damped system
( ) ωd greater than ωn (x) ωd less than ωn ( ) none of these ( ) ωd equal to ωn
problem.p: 1. What is the value of logarithmic decrement if amplitude drops by 2 times between consecutive peaks ?
2. The amplitude of a damped system will not change with time.

3. A rod 20 mm diameters and 1.2 m long is simply supported at both end and has a mass of 2kg concentrated at the middle. Ignoring the weight of the rod, calculate the frequency of transverse vibrations. Take E=200 Gpa.?
4. The magnification factor is the ratio of maximum amplitude and static deflection.
